author: ralexstokes
content:
not really other than it may be simplest to just keep the existing stuff and only use the new endpoint for the new data

client devs should chime in tho

author: bridge-bot
content: <divagant_martian> for us in LH it would probably be easier allowing BeaconBlockAndBlobsSidecarByRootV1 to serve pre and post data. But wouldn't actually remove the old BeaconBlocksByRootV2

author: timbeiko
content: <@804047680195395675> I updated the 4844 readiness checklist today with (AFAICT) the latest links for all clients üëç https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room/4844-readiness-checklist.md

author: waltsmith.
content: Tim saw you comment on Twitter abt 4844 spec, specifically propagation in the CL making it impossible to implement on Polygon & BSC -- are other EVM-based chains also effected? Avax or Near for instance?

author: timbeiko
content: Any EVM chain without a beacon chain can't do 4844 'as is'

author: timbeiko
content: but this is also true of, say, withdrawals or even EIP-4399

author: waltsmith.
content: got it; essentially this means rollups settling to other networks won't have differentiated fee mrkts (better resource pricing) and their rollups will be more expensive

author: timbeiko
content: first part is correct, second part is hard to know (I have no idea what Polygon or Near gas prices are)

author: timbeiko
content: if Near was 100x cheaper than L2s and 4844 make rollups 10x cheaper, then it might still be cheaper?

author: dapplion
content:
<@203220829473996800> Are this statements true for a tx of type blob tx? (fields from BlobTransaction container)
- to field Union always of type Address (i.e. never None)
- Always have empty data field
- Always have empty access_list field
